homePage.header: Call of Duty Black Ops Wii is Back!
homePage.description: Following the complete shutdown of the Wii's online services in 2023, all Call of Duty games on the platform lost access to their multiplayer features. However, thanks to the efforts of a talented team of developers, these services have been restored, allowing players to once again enjoy Call of Duty online on the Wii. Currently, only Call of Duty: Black Ops has been revived, while the restoration of other titles requires further investigation and development.

gettingStartedPage.description: This page will guide you in getting online for Black Ops Wii. If you are having difficulties please click the "Support" button to get help.

steps.title: Prerequisties
steps.description: In order to play Black Ops Online, you will need the homebrew channel. If you do not already have the Homebrew Channel installed, please click the link on the right hand site to be taken to the Wii Hacks Guide website.

steps.title: Download CoDN-T5 files
steps.description: Click the download button to download the CoDN Installer Files.

steps.title: Extract the Contents to your Wii's SD card
steps.description: Make sure the following files are located on the SD Card: SC7E52.dol, SC7P52.dol and the apps folder. Note if you already have an apps folder just copy the content inside apps/ into your apps directory.

steps.title: Open Homebrew Channel
steps.description: On your Wii, with the SD Card and your disc copy of Black Ops inserted, open the homebrew channel

steps.title: Run CodN TU Installer (First Time Only)
steps.description: Run the installer only if you do not have v51 already installed. Attempting to launch without v51 will result in an error message

steps.title: Run CodN Client
steps.description: Run the client to launch into the game. Note: you will always need to run the client in order to be able to play online.

steps.title: You are all set!
steps.description: If all went well, you should have been booted directly into Multiplayer! If you are having issues please click the support button to be taken to our Discord!

steps.title: Prerequisties
steps.description: In order to play Black Ops Online, you will need the homebrew channel. If you do not already have the Homebrew Channel installed, please click the link on the right hand site to be taken to the Wii Hacks Guide website.

steps.title: Download CoDN-T5 files
steps.description: Click the download button to download the CoDN Installer Files.

steps.title: Extract the Contents to your Wii's SD card
steps.description: Make sure the following files are located on the SD Card: SC7E52.dol, SC7P52.dol and the apps folder. Note if you already have an apps folder just copy the content inside apps/ into your apps directory.

steps.title: (Non NTSC and PAL Versions Only) Rename SC7E52.dol to the title ID of your copy
steps.description: This step is required if you are not running the NTSC or PAL Versions.

steps.title: Open USB Loader GX
steps.description: On your Wii, with the SD Card inserted, open USB Loader GX

steps.title: Select Settings
steps.description: In USB Loader, select Black Ops then select Settings

steps.title: Set Alternate DOL to Load from SD/USB
Start Black Ops
steps.description: Return to the settings and start screen and select start to launch the game. Your settings should remain persistent so you will not need to edit anything again.

steps.title: You are all set!
steps.description: If all went well, you should have been booted directly into Multiplayer! If you are having issues please click the support button to be taken to our Discord!

steps.title: Prerequisties
steps.description: In order to play on Dolphin Emulator, you are required to import a NAND backup. Please click the link on the right to learn how.

steps.title: Download CoDN-T5 files
steps.description: Click the download button to download the CoDN Installer Files.

steps.title: Extract the Contents to your Dolphin SD Card Folder
steps.description: Dolphin allows the user to set a folder to act as their SD Card. Basically this folder would be equivalent to the root of an SD Card used for a real Wii. You can set this path in Dolphin -> Config -> Wii

steps.title: Make sure Automatically Sync with Folder is Checked
Right Click Black Ops and Select Set as Default ISO
Click Open in the Dolphin Options Panel
Click Open in the Dolphin Options Panel
Select the boot.dol File to Launch the Game
steps.description: Important: You must select the boot.dol file located in the apps/codn-client folder located in the same folder as you Dolphin SD Card folder

steps.title: You are all set!
steps.description: If all went well, you should have been booted directly into Multiplayer! If you are having issues please click the support button to be taken to our Discord!
